USA: The 2018 Southern California landslides took place and resulted in the deaths of 13 people and 25 injuries
The Hawaii Emergency Management Agency announced a missile attack could take place, resulting in Hawaii's citizens panicking.
An 8.0-magnitude earthquake took place near the southern coast of Alaska.
The Philadelphia Eagles claim victory in the Super Bowl for the first time.
A school shooting took place at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, claiming the lives of 17 students.
Teachers in West Virginia create the first ever statewide strike in the history of West Virginia.
President Trump announces a plan to create the largest ever package of sanctions against North Korea to remove the revenue for their nuclear weapons program.
A large windstorm hits Maryland, Virginia and Washington DC.
Robert Mueller issues a subpoena to the Trump Organization.
Over 12 states sued the Trump administration.
A Trump Tower resident died in a fire in the 50th floor.
